properties.title: Ant Plugin for Vulcan Build Manager

tr.td: If your project build script is named something other than build.xml, or is not in the top level directory, you can specify a relative path to your build script.
You can override your build script's default target by specifying targets here, separated by spaces.
Select which Java Home to use to run Ant. New profiles can be defined in the Ant plugin global configuration.
Check this box to pass the switch -verbose to Ant. This will result in a much larger build log, useful for troubleshooting when your build script is not working.

Check this box to pass the switch -debug to Ant. This will result in a much larger build log, useful for troubleshooting when Verbose Logging does not provide enough insight to resolve a build script issue.

Properties, in the form name=value. Properties defined here will be added to properties defined in the global Ant plugin configuration. Project properties will override global property values. It is not necessary to include the -D switch which is used on the command line to define an Ant property, although if you do this the plugin will still correctly configure the property.
